title: Russia Bombards Ukraine Port After Bridge Attack and Grain Deal Collapse
description: Russian forces launched a barrage of missiles and drones at Odesa, not usually a major target, a day after important shifts in the conduct of the war.

title: U.N. Officials Urge Regulation of AI at Security Council Meeting
description: Security Council members said they feared that a new technology might prove a major threat to world peace.

title: U.S. Blacklists Two Spyware Firms Run by an Israeli Former General
description: The moves by the Commerce Department against the Europe-based firms are the latest effort to rein in a spyware industry that has spiraled out of control in recent years.

title: The U.S. Announces $750 Million in Aid for Ukraine
description: The new funds will go toward food assistance, health and hygienic care, and providing emergency shelter, the agency said.

title: Legacy of Boris Johnson Looms Over By-election to Replace Him
description: The vote to pick a new member of Parliament in the ex-prime minister’s once-reliably Conservative district is just one of three by-elections on Thursday that will give a snapshot of Britain’s mood.

title: Extreme Heat Grips 3 Continents as Climate Change Warms Earth
description: Across North America, Europe and Asia, hundreds of millions of people endured blistering conditions. The U.S. special envoy for climate change called it “a threat to all of humankind.”

title: Extreme Heat Grips 3 Continents as Climate Change Warms Earth
description: Across North America, Europe and Asia, hundreds of millions of people endured blistering conditions. The U.S. special envoy for climate change called it “a threat to all of humankind.”

title: Arresting Putin in South Africa Would Risk War, President Says
description: The assertion, made in a court affidavit, was the clearest indication yet that South Africa was seeking any way possible to avoid arresting the Russian leader on an international warrant at a long-planned BRICS summit in Johannesburg next month.

title: Australian Man and His Dog Rescued After Nearly 3 Months at Sea
description: “I have not had food, enough food, for a long time,” Tim Shaddock, 54, said after he and his dog, Bella, were found floating aboard a catamaran, 1,200 miles from land in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Patrick Zaki, Student and Rights Advocate, Is Jailed by Egypt
description: The case of Patrick Zaki, who had been studying in Italy and was convicted of spreading “fake news,” prompted an outpouring of support in two countries.

title: King Charles III Earned Record Income from Rental Properties
description: Rents are rising across Britain, and the nation’s most famous landlord was no exception. He received about $34 million from his real estate portfolio.

title: Cerberus or Caronte? Why Europe Is Starting to Name Heat Waves
description: The World Meteorological Organization has warned against naming heat wave events and said it has no plans to do so, despite calls by some experts who say names could raise awareness about heat’s dangers.

title: Protests Meet Bibby Stockholm, U.K. Barge for Asylum Seekers
description: Some of those protesting the Bibby Stockholm’s arrival in southern England wanted better treatment for refugees. Others opposed bringing migrants to the area. None wanted the barge.

title: Heat Divide Leaves Low-Income Workers Among the Most Vulnerable
description: Europe’s latest heat wave has highlighted the inequities between those who can afford to shelter from the heat and those who can’t.

title: Heat Divide Leaves Low-Income Workers Among the Most Vulnerable
description: Europe’s latest heat wave has highlighted the inequities between those who can afford to shelter from the heat and those who can’t.

title: Thailand’s Prime Minister Vote Puts Coalition at Risk
description: The progressive Move Forward Party has failed to form a government, leaving members of the liberal opposition scrambling to find alternatives.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Fires Drones and Missiles at Southern Ukraine
description: A day after blaming Kyiv for attacking a bridge to occupied Crimea, Russia launched a wave of strikes from the Black Sea, Ukrainian officials said.

title: The Economic Fallout From Extreme Heat Will Rise Over Time
description: Among the costs of very high temperatures: reduced labor productivity, damaged crops, higher mortality rates, trade disruption and dampened investment.

title: As Heat Waves Descend on Europe, So Do Tourists
description: Soaring temperatures have gripped the continent during one of its most popular travel seasons.

title: Wildfires Force Residents to Flee Greek Seaside Villages
description: Thousands of acres have burned, leaving residents and firefighters scrambling.

title: Moscow Warns Ukraine Against Shipping Grain Across the Black Sea Without Its Consent
description: The Kremlin’s comments came after Ukraine’s leader called for the shipments to continue despite Russia’s withdrawal from a landmark grain deal.

title: U.S. Nuclear-Capable Sub Visits South Korea for First Time in Decades
description: The submarine made a port call as part of Washington’s effort to show its commitment to defending its East Asian ally.

title: North Korea Detains U.S. Citizen After Unauthorized Border Crossing
description: The man is the first known American to be held in North Korean custody since Otto F. Warmbier, the student who was arrested in Pyongyang in 2016.

title: As China Bakes, Kerry Presses Beijing on Climate Change
description: The extreme heat wave choking China has become a talking point for John Kerry, President Biden’s climate envoy, in his meetings with officials in Beijing.

title: Israelis Protest Against Judicial Overhaul
description: Thousands of Israelis blocked roads and demonstrated over Benjamin Netanyahu’s plans to limit the power of the judiciary.

title: Spanish Vote Threatens Efforts to Recover Franco’s Victims
description: Spain’s left-wing government has tried to accelerate exhumations of mass graves left from the dictatorship. If it wins Sunday’s election, the right may end that.

title: Yiddish Is Alive and Well in Melbourne, Australia
description: Australia has the largest proportion of Holocaust survivors of any country besides Israel. In Melbourne, some of their descendants are leading the way to preserve the Yiddish language.

title: Israeli President to Meet With Biden Amid U.S. Unease With Netanyahu
description: President Biden’s meeting with Isaac Herzog and accompanying declarations of support for Israel have masked strains between the White House and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Victoria, Australia, Backs Out as Host of 2026 Commonwealth Games
description: The state of Victoria cited budget issues in deciding not to stage the multisports competition, originally known as the British Empire Games, raising questions about the event’s fading prestige.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Thawing relations between Israel and the U.S.

title: Mandela Goes From Hero to Scapegoat as South Africa Struggles
description: Nelson Mandela is revered worldwide and celebrated on July 18, his birthday. But at home, a younger generation is disillusioned with the country, his party and the anti-apartheid leader, too.

title: A Current War Collides With the Past: How World War II Endures in Ukraine
description: World War II has been an ideological battlefield in today’s war in Ukraine, and it is cropping up on the actual battlefield as well.

title: Modi and India’s Diaspora: A Complex Love Affair Making Global Waves
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has tried to fuse his image to the economic and political power of Indians abroad. They voice both pride and worry in return.

title: Corrections: July 18, 2023
description: Corrections that appeared in print on Tuesday, July 18, 2023.
